stories.text:
I created an app based on widely accepted recommendations on getting disciplined. The app is free. It has a todo list that automatically creates reminders in your calendar using natural language processing, trackers for monitoring progress of anything you can think of, and an accountability network to share your daily progress in or to find others.

here's an intro video: https://youtu.be/p8xpBj1HZSc

app info: https://www.atomiclife.app/

iOS App store link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/atomic-life/id1594368125

Android App Store link: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.atomiclifenoexpo

  You can provide feedback at feedback@atomiclife.app or https://www.reddit.com/r/atomiclife/
stories.title: Show HN: Atomic Life â€“ to-do with auto reminders, data tracker and network

stories.text:
I am thinking of starting my blog solely for advancing my career and putting myself out there on the internet. I am a frontend dev and will mostly write posts on JavaScript.

I am not a native English speaker nor have I ever done any serious writing before. Looking for some suggestions on how to get started. What sort of process do I have for making post, should I start posting about basic JavaScript stuff or go with explaining deeper concepts of JS.
stories.title: Ask HN: Getting started with my technical blog. What to write? How to start?
Solo queue is why Western teams failed at Worlds
Unity moves robotics design and training to the metaverse
Error Messages in Haskell, and how to Improve them
How the U.S. Hid an Airstrike That Killed Dozens of Civilians in Syria
